Description: Indicates the likelihood of a consumer owning a home, and is received from tax assessor and deed information.
Renter status is derived from consumer response data. Unit numbers are not used to infer rented status because units may be owner condominium/coop.

Direct Mail Responder information identifies consumers who have purchased by direct mail through multiple companies. Data is carried at both the individual and household level. If one member of a household is a direct mail responder at the individual level, the remaining members of the household will be coded as a direct mail responder at the household level.

Estimated Current Home Value predicts the current home value. Uses county, state and national trends in home sale prices and assessed home values to determine property appreciation rates and current home values. Data was examined at county level and the model inputs, such as sale price, sale year or assessed price of the property that were acquired from realty deed records and county tax assessor records.

Home property indicator indicates the type of property determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located.

The assessed value of the property determined from information recorded at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located. Value in thousands. Valid Values: 0001-9999, 0000=Unknown.

The square footage of any buildings associated with the home determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located. Values in hundreds.
Values: 000=Unknown; whole number value of sq footage

Home bedrooms is determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located.

The base square footage of the home determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located. Values in hundreds.

Description: The name of the original mortgage lender or individual. Mortgage lender name is determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located. Values: Forty bytes Mortgage Lender Name.

The mortgage term in months is determined from grant/warranty deed information recorded or other legal documents filed at the county recorder's office in the county where the property is located. Valid Values: 000-999, 000=Unknown.
Warranty deed date is the date the real estate transaction was recorded in the county. Values: CCYYMMDD

Purchase amount is determined from taxes paid when the grant/warranty deed is recorded in the county where the property is located, or it is estimated from the loan amount or legal documents filed at the county recorder's office. Value in thousands. 0001-9999, 0000 =Unknown

Score combines known children's ages and when not available an Experian model predicting the likelihood a child within the age group is present in the living unit. Score=000-101; where 101 is known and lower scores indicate less likelihood of a child in the LU for this age range. 000-not coded.
Values: Number where higher value indicates higher likelihood of child present for age range.

GreenAware Segmentation targeting system includes attitudes, opinions, lifestyle, buying behavior, and media usage. Based on the distinctive mindset of consumers towards the environment, we can better understand four distinct consumer segments: 1. Behavioral Greens: This group of people thinks and acts green, holds negative attitudes toward products that pollute, incorporate green practices on a regular basis. 2. Think Greens: This group of people thinks green but does not necessarily act green. 3. Potential Greens: They neither behave nor think along particularly environmentally conscious lines, and remain on the fence about key green issues. 4. True Browns: This group of people are not environmentally conscious, and may in fact have negative attitudes about the green movement.

Online Overall Buyer propensity model provides a measure to rank order all ConsumerView households on the likelihood that those consumers would buy online relative to all product categories. The model will rank order all households on ConsumerView from 01-99 based on their likelihood to purchase online within that category. The higher the number, the more likely they are to purchase online regardless of the product category.
Values: 01-99, 00=Unknown; higher number more likely to purchase online

Description: Retail Overall Buyer propensity model provides a measure to rank order all ConsumerView households on the likelihood that those consumers would buy at a retail location relative to all product categories. The model will rank order all households on ConsumerView from 01-99 based on their likelihood to purchase at a retail location within that category. The higher the number, the more likely they are to purchase at a retail location regardless of the product category.
Field Name: Likelihood to Purchase at Retail Location
Values: 01-99, 00=Unknown; higher number more likely to purchase at retail location

Description: The HH Composition Code is based on the composition of males, females and children within the living unit. HH Composition Code is created through a calculation using the person information Experian has in the ConsumerView repository for the respective living unit. The calculation is based on the entire ConsumerView universe (prior to filters for deliverability, do not mail, etc.). For each HH the adult males, females and children are counted; then the HH is coded A-J. The code that the HH qualifies for first will be assigned to the record. Each HH can only be assigned one code. Note: In Enrichment, 0=Non-match.
Values: A= HH w/1 adult F (no adult M - no child),B= HH w/1 adult M (no adult F - no child),C= HH w/1 adult F and 1 adult M (no child),D= HH w/1 adult F + 1 adult M and child present,E= HH w/1 adult F and child present (no adult M),F= HH w/1 adult M and child present (no adult F),G= HH w/2 + adult M (no child - may have adult F),H= HH w/2 + adult F (no child - may have adult M),I= HH w/2 + adult M w/ child present (adult F pos),J= HH w/2 + adult F w/ child present (adult M pos),U=Unable to code

Description: Original loan to value ratio is a percentage of the original home mortgage loan amount divided by the original purchase value of the home. The higher the ratio, the less equity the homeowner has on the house. This ratio is available on wherever the loan amount and estimated current home value are available. Values: 01-99, 00=Unknown.
Values: Higher % ratio = less equity in home

Description: Percentage calculated by dividing the down payment amount by the purchase price of the home. Values: 001-100, 000 = Unknown

Length of Residence (LOR) is the length of time a Living Unit has resided at their current address. A primary source of LOR is public source white page compilation initiating a counter showing the first time a name and number appear in the directory. LOR information is also received from proprietary sources and through updates of our source files against the USPS National Change of Address* file. For all sources, LOR data is aged over time. When there is insufficient data to match a customer's record to our Enhancement master for Length of Residence, a median LOR based on the LOR's assigned to other living units in the same ZIP+4 area is used. In the rare case that the ZIP+4 is not on the record, median LOR is based on the LOR's assigned to other records in that ZIP region. The median level data applied to records for this element can be identified through the Enhancement Mandatory Append - Total Enhancement Match Type indicator (E). Values: 00 = Less than a Year 01-99 = 1 - 99 Years
Values: Values: 00 = Less than a Year 01-99 = 1 - 99 Years

Description: DU Size median

Number of Children in Household information is calculated from the number of records in a household that indicate children whose age is 18 or younger. When there is insufficient data to match a customer's record to our Enhancement master for Number of Children, a median number of children based on the number of children present in other living units in the same ZIP+4 area is used. In the rare case that the ZIP+4 is not on the record, median number of children is based on the number of children present in other records in that ZIP region. The median level data applied to records for this element can be identified through the Enhancement Mandatory Append - Total Enhancement Match Type indicator (E). Values: 0 = Unknown 1 = 1 Child 2 = 2 Children 3 = 3 Children 4 = 4 Children 5 = 5 Children 6 = 6 Children 7 = 7 Children 8 = 8+ Children
Values: 0=0 Children,1=1 Children,2=2 Children,3=3 Children,4=4 Children,5=5 Children,6=6 Children,7=7 Children,8=8 Children,blank=Blank

Description: Number of adults on record
Values: 0=0 Adults,1=1 Adults,2=2 Adults,3=3 Adults,4=4 Adults,5=5 Adults,6=6 Adults,7=7 Adults,8=8 Adults,blank=Blank

The Estimated Available Equity model is Experian's proprietary model designed to accurately predict equity in the home for Homeowner records. The value of equity equals the estimated current home value minus the remaining principal of the mortgage loan. The model inputs, such as sale price, sale date and mortgage amount of the property were acquired from realty deed records from the county court house. Position 1= Confidence flag of 1 = Extremely Likely, 2 = Highly Likely, 3 = Likely. Positions 2-5 = Estimated Equity (in thousands) 0000-9999.

Estimated Current Mortgage Amount model estimates the mortgage amount where it is not available. States are grouped into 6 categories on the basis of similarities among each of the states. There is a separate model for each state grouping. The model input variables, such as Sales Amount of the House, Year of Sale of the House and Assessed Value of the House were acquired from the realty deed records and county tax assessor records. Where mortgage amount was unavailable the median mortgage amount of the block or group of homes in that geographic area was utilized. Values represented in thousands.
Field Name: Real Estate: Estimated Current Mortgage Amount

VantageScore is part of Experian Premier Summarized Credit Statistics (PSCS) and calculated by aggregating the available consumer credit data in a ZIP+4. VantageScore is a a predictive and consistent scoring model, Used across the three Credit Reporting Companies. Predicts the likelihood of future serious delinquencies (90 days late or greater) on any type of account. Values (Implied Decimal): 999v99. Score range of 300-850 (higher scores = lower likelihood of risk). 781850 Super prime 661780. Prime 601660 Nonprime 500600 Subprime 300499 Deep subprime
Values: Score range of 300-850 (higher scores = lower likelihood of risk). 781850 Super prime 661780. Prime 601660 Nonprime 500600 Subprime 300499 Deep subprime

Description: High vs. Low Affluence Score is a CAPE factor variable. Five digit whole number," no decimals. Valid values: 00001-99999. For this factor, a higher score would point to more affluent neighborhoods. A low score would designate less affluent areas.The following variables were used to create this factor. All have positive loadings except % High School Grad.CAPE: Education: Pop25+: % Bachelor DegreeCAPE: HH: % Household Income $150-199KCAPE: HH: Median Income Householder Age 45-54CAPE: HH: Median Non-Family Household IncomeCAPE: HH: Med Inc Householder Age 35-44CAPE: Industry: Employed: % Professional, Science, and Technical ServicesCAPE: HH: % Household Income $125-149KCAPE: HH: Median Income Householder Age 25-34CAPE: Home Value: OO HU: % Home Value $750-999KCAPE: Rent: % Cash Rent $2,000 or MoreCAPE: Occupation: Employed: % ManagementCAPE: Home Value: OO HU: % Home Value $1M or MoreCAPE: Occupation: Employed: % LegalCAPE: Education: Pop25+: % High School Grad
Values: Valid values: 00001-99999. For this factor, a higher score would point to more affluent neighborhoods. A low score would designate less affluent areas.
